perturbation.changed_text:
"INTELLECTUAL      means patents, trade marks, service marks, trade names,
PROPERTY RIGHTS"   design rights (whether registrable or not), any applications
                   for the foregoing, copyright and other assignable

perturbation.explanation: By explicitly *excluding* the format, layout, and look and feel of the Content from the definition of "Intellectual Property Rights", this change directly contradicts standard IP law. Copyright law typically protects the unique arrangement and presentation of content, so explicitly excluding these elements introduces legal uncertainty and could render the intellectual property protections significantly weaker and unenforceable.

7.   TERM
7.1  This Agreement shall take effect from the Effective Date and continue in
     full force and effect for twenty (20) years thereafter, unless otherwise
     terminated in accordance with Clause 8.
7.2  This Agreement may be renewed for an additional term of ten (10) years by
     notice in writing given by XFN to CEIS at the expiry of the Term, for a
     consideration to be mutually agreed.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.   TERM
7.1  This Agreement shall take effect from the Effective Date and continue in
     full force and effect for twenty (20) years thereafter, unless otherwise
     terminated in accordance with Clause 8.
7.2  This Agreement *cannot* be renewed for an additional term of ten (10) years by
     notice in writing given by XFN to CEIS at the expiry of the Term, for a
     consideration to be mutually agreed.
perturbation.explanation: By changing "may be renewed" to "cannot be renewed", this modification creates a direct conflict within the contract itself. The original clause provides an option for renewal, while the modified clause eliminates that option. This contradiction introduces ambiguity regarding the parties' intentions and the enforceability of the agreement beyond the initial term.

perturbation.original_text:
8.   TERMINATION
8.1  XFN may terminate this Agreement by giving thirty (30) days written notice
     to the CEIS.
8.2  Either Party may terminate this Agreement:
     (a)  if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement which
          is not capable of being remedied;
     (b)  if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement which
          is capable of being remedied but not remedied within thirty (30) days
          upon receiving written notice from the non-breaching party requiring
          remedy; and
     (c)  if the other Party becomes insolvent or bankrupt.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.   TERMINATION
8.1  XFN may terminate this Agreement by giving thirty (30) days written notice
     to the CEIS.
8.2  *Only* a single Party may terminate this Agreement:
     (a)  if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement which
          is not capable of being remedied;
     (b)  if the other Party commits a material breach of this Agreement which
          is capable of being remedied but not remedied within thirty (30) days
          upon receiving written notice from the non-breaching party requiring
          remedy; and
     (c)  if the other Party becomes insolvent or bankrupt.
perturbation.explanation: By changing “Either Party” to “Only a single Party,” the modification introduces a direct contradiction and ambiguity. It becomes unclear which party is allowed to terminate the agreement under the stated conditions. This contradiction significantly impairs the contract's enforceability, especially in dispute resolution scenarios, as the termination rights are now uncertain and subject to conflicting interpretations.
